I was thinking about a easy way to dock. The original Docking Mode is almost useless and the "NavyFish Docking Port Alignement" is a very good help, but still perfectible. I've got the idea of a laser coming out from the target docking port, that you can use to find a good alignement. In my opinion, the laser plus the Docking Port Alignement, will make every docking more easy and also a little more realistic. IRL lasers are used in docking. 

Is anyone interested in this? I'm not skilled at all in coding...

MechJeb's Docking Autopilot is very accurate - you can specify the precise angular offset between docked ports, and it will perform the docking automatically for you (while also preventing collisions between vessels)
I know, but I think that many people like to manually dock two ship as I like it. I just felt that something was missing, that's all...

> 
> I know, but I think that many people like to manually dock two ship as I like it. I just felt that something was missing, that's all...

Romfarer's Lazor system add-on had a docking camera, which displays a view from the docking port itself, as well as numerical readouts of distance/angular offsets to the target port.

That's a really good news, I'll try it very soon. Do you know if it exists a mod that add a ILS too?

By the way, congratulations for your Service Module System. I used it in the past before Ram stopped me.
